alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; North Snowy Range Foothills; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 1:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Carbon County through 145 AM MDT... At 1259 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sinclair, or near Rawlins, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rawlins and Sinclair. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 214 and 237. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; North Snowy Range Foothills; Upper North Platte River Basin
